fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

We have recently introduced the epic panel in next gen projects! With this capability, you can order your epics by dragging and dropping epics around in the panel. The same order will be reflected in your roadmap and board.

To learn more and/or provide feedback about the epic panel, read [our community post here.|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Improved-Backlog-planning-in-next-gen-with-the-epic-panel/ba-p/1387675]

Thank you, 
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}

Users should be able to sort the epic in the next-gen project.
When the users have a long list of epic, it is difficult to scroll and find the required epic one by one.

 

Also a feature to be able to drag and drop the Epic fields would be helpful
fields.summary: To be able to sort the epic in the next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently in the *Active Sprint* view on a Board, there is no clear indication of the progress you've made in the Sprint to verify if you're running behind schedule.

The only way to verify this is in the *Burndown Chart* and even that doesn't give a fixed number as you would need to compare the *Guideline* (grey line) with the *Remaining values* (red line) to have an idea if you're falling behind the estimated velocity.

 !burndown.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Add a bar to the *Active Sprint* view gives the value of work done, work remaining and an auto-calculation of by how much you're behind schedule.

This information can also be added to the *Burndown Chart* in a numerical form so you wouldn't have to refer to the graph.
fields.summary: See if you're running behind schedule in Active Sprint view

h3. Summary

When you have an user set as *Location* of a board, the 'View on Board' shortcut from issue view will not work properly. It will redirect you to a different board.
h3. Easiest steps to Reproduce
 # Create a kanban project with at least two boards.
 # Set an user as location for one of the two boards
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-18 at 19.08.16.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to an issue of your board, and select the shortcut View on Board (You need to have the new issue view turned off as this option only exists in the classic issue view.)
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-18 at 19.10.26.png|thumbnail!
 # You'll be redirect to the wrong board, although if you click in the board settings, you'll see the correct board name
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-18 at 19.12.36.png|thumbnail!

From the console, you'll see this error message when loading the board:
{code:java}
batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:11836 GET https://valmontutilities.atlassian.net/rest/projects/1.0/project/undefined/shortcut?shortcutType=source.code.link&_=1545165978784 404
XMLHttpRequest.send{code}
{"errorMessages":["No project could be found with key 'undefined'."],"errors":{}}
h3. Workaround

Set the *Board Location* to a Project

h3. Description

# Access the Kanban/Scrum classic board
# At the card, press control+click at the issue key
# Do not select any option, just press ESC to cancel the action
# The card will be selected AND active for moving/changing its state

By pressing ESC it should release the selection and card should not be selected and active for moving/changing its state

The card is selected AND active for moving/changing its state

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Epics rank changes on the roadmap do not persist. When a user refreshes the page after they have made changes to the order of epics, they go back to their previous order.

h2. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, roadmaps of next-gen projects

h2. Steps to reproduce
* Create a new next-gen project
* Go to Project settings > Issue types and delete the Epic issue type
* Go back to the project and open the roadmap
* You will be prompted to create a new epic issue type
* Click the button to create a new epic issue type
* Create several epics, change their order
* Reload the page

h2. Expected behaviour
Epics show up in the same order after the page reload as before

h2. Actual behaviour
Epics are reverted back to their original order that relates to their creation order

h2. Workaround
* Go to the Project settings > Issue types
* Create a new issue type "Temporary Epic" (or whatever name you like)
* Delete the "Epic" issue type and select to _Change all existing Epics to_ "Temporary Epic" in the modal that opens
* Rename the "Temporary Epic" issue type to "Epic" (or whatever the name of your previous epic issue type was)
* Go back to the roadmap and click on the "Add epic issue type" button
* Select the "Convert existing issue type" option
* Pick your newly created issue type and click "Convert"
From now on, all rank operations will work again
fields.summary: Ranking of epics does not persist in next-gen projects when epic issue type was created from the roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira shows translated status name (transition name tends to have the same name) to users.
Also, admins can create their own transition which name consists of multi-byte characters.
However, Smart Commit cannot handle those non-ascii transition names and silently fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up the DVCS connection
# Create a transition which name is "レビュー中" (meaning in-review)
# Create an issue
# Commit an arbitrary file with a commit-message like below
{code:none}
JRA-1 #レビュー中 #comment Fixed this today
{code}


h3. Expected Results

Specified transition works.

h3. Actual Results

Transition command will be ignored whilst comment command works.

h3. Notes
Related documents:

* [Connect your next\-gen board with Bitbucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/connect-your-next-gen-board-with-bitbucket-946603735.html]
* [Processing issues with Smart Commits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/processing-issues-with-smart-commits-788960027.html#id-_smart_commits_commands1-transition]

h3.Workaround

* None
fields.summary: Smart Commit doesn't take account of non-ascii transition name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user who is not a Jira administrator is not being able to create sprints on a board with a complex filter, although he has the manage sprints permission in all projects (classic).

If you have a limited next-gen project in your Jira, only admins can manage sprints in a classic board with a complex filter.

h3. Environment

* Jira Software Cloud 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create 2 Jira Software classic projects and add issues to them
# Create 1 limited a next-gen project and add issues to it
# Create a board using a complex case (using the filter "issuetype = Story", for example) and share it with anyone
# Grant the mange sprint permission to a user who is not an administrator on the classic projects
# Log into Jira using a user who is not an administrator
# Create a sprint on the complex board


h3. Expected

The user can create the sprint since he has the manage sprints permission

h3. Actual

The user cannot create the sprint and a pop-up is displayed on the board saying that only administrators can create sprints on that board
 
h3. Notes



h3. Workaround

Grant access to the affected user to all next-gen boards
fields.summary: Limited next-gen projects prevent a user without administrative permissions to create and manage sprints on a board with a complex filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The development panel in Jira will show a wrong number of branches (less than real) if there are branches with the exact same name in different repositories linked to the same issue

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud integrated with Bitbucket (or Github)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch and link it to a Jira issue
# Create a branch with the exact same name but in a different repo and link it to the same issue

h3. Expected Results
The development panel in Jira would show 2 branches

h3. Actual Results
The development panel shows only 1 branch, but when clicking it, 2 branches are shown
 
h3. Notes
This bug only affects the integration with BitBucket Cloud and it happens when 2 branches, in 2 different repositories, have the exact same name.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: wrong number of branches in the development panel if branches have the same name

fields.description:
Next-gen projects are the newest projects in Jira Software. 
Our teams have totally reimagined the product to focus on making it easier to use and more powerful for modern software teams. In this new experience, software teams have more autonomy in the way they work while still delivering the power Jira administrators expect.

The Next-gen projects are already available for our customers but we are still working to deliver all functionalities we know from old times Jira in a simpler, more intuitive, and more consistent way.

In order to keep you as informed as possible, we're collecting missing features in this issue's subtasks. As features become available, we'll update the subtasks to let you know what's changed.
fields.summary: Team-managed software projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to rank/add issues to sprint on Next-gen projects if the issue type was added after the 
 project's creation.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen project
 # Add a new issue type
 # Create issues with Story type
 # Create issues with the new issue type
 # Create a sprint
 # Add the Story issues to the sprint, and it will work
 # Try adding the issues using the new type to the sprint
 # Refresh the board page and issues added on step 7 won't be in the sprint

h3. Expected Results

All issues are added to the sprint or ranked
h3. Actual Results

Issues using the new issue type won't be ranked/added to sprints
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

Go to the board's _Features_ page and toggle the _Sprint_ feature

fields.description:
Hello,

We're organising a number of individual client projects in Jira and have set the global permissions about browsing users to apply only to our administrators and our own employee-group.

While that's working for us very well, our clients who are a part of our projects as Developer-role, cannot browse users and mention them in issue comments at all due to the restriction. Hence, would it be possible to somehow tailor the global permission to allow browsing of a specific group to a group of clients? Pre-requisite here would be that there's a group of clients who'd get the permission and a group of employees, that is the group they can browse. 

 

This way we could ensure that our clients can always tag our own employees but not see any other clients of ours.
fields.summary: Browse users - global permission tailoring

fields.description:
Currently, the next-gen access level works as defined below:

* *Open*. When a next-gen software project is open, Jira gives all licensed users (regardless of application access) the *Member* role. People can view your project’s issues, and create or edit issues in your project.

* *Limited*. When a next-gen software project is limited, Jira gives all users on your Jira site the *Viewer* role. They can search for and view issues in your project, but they can’t create or edit them.

* *Private*. When a next-gen software project is private, you manually give people access to your project via the *People* page in your project's settings. If you haven’t added a person or group, they cannot search for, view or interact with your project’s issues in any way. Read more about adding people to a next-gen project.

Further information you can find in the [overview of permissions in next-gen projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/overview-of-permissions-in-next-gen-projects-959283605.html].

Only the project creator is added as a project administrator

h4. Solution suggested

All administrators users should be added as next-gen project administrators when a next-gen project is created.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator, I want all administrators users to be added as next-gen project administrators when a next-gen project is created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Features and issue types are missing on Next-gen project
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the next-gen project
 # Go to _project settings_

h3. Expected Results

Features and issue types options are listed on left side menu
h3. Actual Results

Only _details_ and _people_ options are displayed
h3. Notes

Impacted projects are hybrid, they were created with Agility (before next-gen) .
h3. Workaround

Create a new project and move the issues from the impacted project to the new one
fields.summary: Features and issue types are missing on Next-gen project

fields.description:
The avatar quick filter on Boards has been updated and the ability to search for users has been removed.

Now, you only see the avatar of users that have activity on the Board. A maximum of 6 avatars can be visible and the rest are nested in a list. This can potentially be problematic if there are a large number of users and have to scroll down that list to find them.

 !KANBAN_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Add a search function to this list
fields.summary: Search for users in avatar quick filter

fields.description:
*Problem definition*

Currently, the team-managed (formerly next-gen) custom fields can be used only in the projects where they are created, it is not possible to reuse the fields in other projects.

In can demand a big effort to create the same custom fields in many different team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

*Impact*

It can take some time in order to create the same custom fields in many different projects. Having the team-managed (formerly next-gen) custom fields shared among projects would save time and would allow users to keep the projects alike in configuration.

*Suggested resolution*

Add the possibility to use the same custom fields among different team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects
fields.summary: As a Jira team-managed (formerly next-gen) project admin, I want to be able to use the same custom fields in different team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Software Cloud users would like the ability to create *multiple boards* for each *team-managed* (formerly next-gen) project, just as they can with company-managed (formerly Classic) projects.

*Workarounds:*
 # Use “dummy” inactive sprint containers in the team-managed backlog as placeholders for different types of work like “design”, “QA”, “eng health” and “feature work”. Pull issues into active sprint container representing the board when the work is prioritised and ready for sprint.
 # Use different team-managed projects to represent different types of work, if the workstreams are totally distinct and separate, and doesn't require any form of "syncing".
 # Use company-managed projects (but you will have to deal with project schemes for project setups).

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of May 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hi all,

We are kicking off the *product discovery phase* for *multiple boards per project* in the next few weeks.

From the product perspective, our main focus right now is to enable the ability to *create multiple boards +within one team-managed project+*, which will be tracked on this Jira feature suggestion.

For example, this capability will enable teams to have separate boards representing functional/design vs. development sprints, Scrum vs. Kanban agile methodologies, feature work vs. bugs, web app vs. mobile.

If you want to help us understand the problem space better, please help us [answer this 3-minutes survey|https://forms.gle/PNUyCDXXf2PmRuva6].

As we continue our progress on this feature, we’ll provide further updates. We’ll also be reaching out to customers, as we refine our solution to ensure that we are addressing customer pain points.

In the short-term, when you need to have multiple boards in a single project, we recommend teams to use company-managed projects. We apologise for the inconvenience that this may cause you.

*+Note:+*
 We’ve gone through all the feedback specified in this Jira ticket and identified feedback which represent separate feature suggestions. You can vote for these other feature suggestions below:
 # *Cross-project roadmaps and boards:* Pull in epics or issues from other projects to display on your roadmap or board, in order to enable cross-team visibility for planning and tracking work:
 ** Cross-project roadmap:  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-20703
 ** Cross-project board: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17444
 # *Multiple active sprints:* Manage 2 concurrent active sprints in the same backlog:
 ** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17195

Thank you,
 Ivan Teong
 Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow multiple boards in team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With a combination of to many *Columns* and a long *Issue key*, if a card is dragged to another position on a Board, the Issue key gets cropped and become hidden until the page is refreshed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a long Issue key (ie:ISSUE-9385)
# Have many columns (with enough columns, the long issue key won't matter)
# Drag card to another position on the Board

h3. Expected Results

Card position is changed, all card info visible.
 !My_Personal_Board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
All cards in the column get their issue key cropped and become hidden.
 !1232.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

This does not concern the *Backlog* view, only the *Active Sprint* or *Kanban Board* views.

h3.Workaround

Refreshing the page fixes it. In addition, reducing the amount of *Columns* in the Board eliminates the problem
fields.summary: Issue key becomes hidden on card after dragging the card

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is not possible to resize the width of the columns of team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.

 !column width.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users o resize the width of the columns of team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.

h3. Why this is important
This feature would greatly improve the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
Users can still collapse the left sidebar using the *[* key to add more space.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to resize the width of the columns of team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description: As a project manager I want to separate Epics by color as described in [https://www.atlassian.com/agile/tutorials/epics#EditingorRenaminganEpic-Changingthecolourofanepic]. Please add this functionality to Next-Gen projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A Javascript error is thrown when the 'Where is my field?' option is clicked. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Navigate to a Kanban/Scrum board 
 # From the Epic Panel, open any epic and select the option 'Create issue in epic'
 # Click the Configure Fields, and select 'Where is my field?' option
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-28 at 18.02.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

'Where is my field?' screen shows up
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-28 at 18.00.22.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The following Javascript error is thrown in the dev tools and customers see a spinning wheel on screen forever
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-28 at 18.00.52.png|thumbnail! 

{code:java}Exception: Uncaught Uknown current dialog ID: create-epic-issue-dialog{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Selecting a quickfilter (Epic, for example) in a next-gen board modifies the URL in the browser. Copying and pasting that URL that includes the _issueParent_ does not preserve the selection of the epic and defaults to the board's standard view

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, next-gen project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In a next-gen board's backlog, select a quickfilter based on an epic from the drop-down. Notice that the URL in the browser changes and an _issueParent_ element is added. Copy that URL and paste it in another browser tab

h3. Expected Results
The board's backlog will open with the same quick filter selected

h3. Actual Results
The default view of the board's backlog is open (no selection for any Epic)


h3. Workaround
None know at this moment
fields.summary: deep linking for quick filters does not work in next-gen boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The copy Board function will fail if the *Swimlane* query of the original Board is too long (255 characters)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add Swimlane queries to a Board and make sure the query/JQL is more than 255 characters
# Copy that Board from the View all Boards page

h3. Expected Results

Board is copied successfully.

h3. Actual Results
You get a *Board wasn't copied. Something went wrong. Try again* error in JIRA frontend, but the Board is still created with many missing settings including the Board admin that will be empty.

 !board_error.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The backend gives this error
{code}
.... was aborted: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)  Call getNextException to see other errors in the batch.\n\tat org.postgresql.jdbc.BatchResultHandler.handleError(BatchResultHandler.java:148)
{code}

h3.Workaround

Instead of using the full JQL as the query for the Swimlane, save that query as a filter and use that in your query (filter = <filter_id>)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
(i) If this is expected behaviour and the character limit shouldn't exceed 255 characters, then the *Swimlane* query box shouldn't allow users to save the query and the error can be shown here first hand.
{panel}
fields.summary: Copy Board fails if Swimlane query to long

fields.description:
When linking an issue to an existing epic, the suggestions and search results include closed epics. This makes it difficult to find and select the correct epic.

I suggest that either:

 # Closed epics are labelled or highlighted as closed in the results/suggestions
fields.summary: Closed epics should not appear in suggestions or search results

fields.description:
Currently, on a board of next-gen project, the cards only show the icon of the issue type, the issue summary, issue key and the assignee's avatar.
It would be great if we could customize the card to add more helpful information, such as priority. For now, we must click on the card to open the issue and check the priority.
We already had a response on [JSWCLOUD-17268|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17268] saying that there are plans to add priority in the backlog, but it would be nice if priority is also added on cards.
fields.summary: Show priority icon on cards when using Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
Use Case

In resolving a Jira, I must do several things:
 * Change the time remaining to zero
 * Add a comment 
 * Add a link to documentation or testing
 * Change the status of the issue to Done

In this scenario, I receive four notifications. It would be nice if it would wait a minute and combine them all into one email. Better yet, stop notifying me of changes that I made — I know what I did!
fields.summary: Delay notifications by a few minutes and combine changes into a single email.

fields.description:
When editing an issue, I can press the "..." button in order to access the "Log Work" action. Upon logging work, a popup appears stating "Work logged... (etc)". This popup covers up the "..." button, which is annoying placement when I want to performing multiple actions. 

Can you reposition this popup so it doesn't cover important parts of the UI?
fields.summary: The "Log Work" confirmation popup covers the "..." menu

fields.description:
After using the function 'print selected card' the description is shown cut out/cropped and you only see a few words on the card.

It's expected that the whole description is shown on the card.
fields.summary: Print Cards Description cut out

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently there is a known issue where board loading slows down due to specific board configurations.

h3.Symtoms of Problem

If you are able to replicate slow loading of JIRA Software boards locally, do check the configurations of the board to see if there have the following configurations :

* Days field in the board status column.
* Numerous card color configuration.
* Multiple swimlanes

Try removing these configurations to see if the loading speeds up after its removal. If board loading time improves, then it is probably due to this bug.

h3.Workaround

* Removal of the day field from the board columns.
* Remove card colors. 
* Remove swimlanes.
fields.summary: Rapidboard low scalability causing slow loading of boards

fields.description: As a user, it would be good to have Checkbox list in the description as it becomes easy to track work or progress if multiple things are there in the description
fields.summary: Checkbox list in description should be there

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Non English characters are not recognized in the Project > Pages > "Connect a space" > "Create new Confluence space" dialog
 * User is unable to create a Confluence space from the JSW project via "Pages" if the space name doesn't contain at least two Latin letters or numbers

h3. Environment
 * Jira Software(JSW)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to: Project > Pages > "Connect a space" > "Create new Confluence space"
 # Enter a name consisting of only non-English alphabet characters without numbers
 # Try to create a new Confluence space

h3. Expected Results
 * The "Create space" button is enabled
 * A new space can be created

h3. Actual Results
 * "Create space" button stays grayed out
 * Error message appears: "Space names requires at least two letters or numbers"
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-26 at 22.28.44.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * !Screen Shot 2018-11-26 at 22.29.14.png|thumbnail!
Example: Adding "ee" allows the space to be created

h3. Workaround
 * Create the space in Confluence, then connect to the space via the JSW project > Pages > "Connect a space"
 * Use at least two English characters or numbers within the space name
fields.summary: Unable to create Confluence space: Non English characters not recognized in Project > Pages dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As outlined in [Printing issue cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/printing-issue-cards-785332012.html], when multiple cards are selected in _Scrum backlog, Active sprints, Kanban backlog (if enabled)_, there should be an option to *Print Selected Cards*, it indeed has the option to print cards, but it's not possible to select different cards from different columns, it's possible to select cards from one column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board and add issues on different status (columns).
# Try to select issues from different columns while pressing and holding down the 'Shift' or 'Ctrl' (as mentioned on the documentation). 

h3. Expected Results

It's possible to select multiple cards, right click and print.

h3. Actual Results

We can print all cards or only cards from the same column.
fields.summary: Select multiple cards from different columns is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Parent Link is added to the card layout and the board filter returns an expressive amount of sub-tasks, the board fails to load.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter that returns several sub-tasks (e.g. 2000)
# Create a board and add *Parent Link* field to the card layout

h3. Expected Results
Board loads 

h3. Actual Results
Board remains blank or the error *Failed to execute search* is shown
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3. Workaround
* Remove *Parent Link* from the card layout or reduce the amount of sub-tasks returned by the filter.
fields.summary: Board fails to load when Parent Link is added to the card layout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Introducing a piece of HTML code in a code block does not work
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud, new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In an issue's description or in a comment, add a code block with language HTML. Paste some HTML text in that code block
h3. Expected Results
The HTML code will be shown correctly

h3. Actual Results
An error message pops up: The text editor failed:
 !text editor.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
The only available workaround is disabling the new issue view under *Profile* → *Personal Settings*
fields.summary: new text editor does not work with HTML code blocks

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. Enabling you to customise the fields you see on the cards in the Board and Backlog is something that will be available in team-managed projects, although it is not something that we will be focusing on in the next 6 months. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

In the short term, we recommend teams use company-managed projects when you need to customise your card layout. We apologise for the inconvenience this may cause you.

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams find value when customising card layout. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will satisfy your needs.

Thank you,
Mark Z
 Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As a project admin, I want to be able to customise the fields shown on the card in the backlog and on the board for next-gen projects.

As of today, it is *only possible to show the due date, the priority field, and the estimation field* when they are configured on an issue type.

If you are looking for the ticket related to card colour support, you can watch and vote on this ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to customise the fields shown on cards in team-managed projects (backlog + board)

fields.description:
According to [Get started with next-gen projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/get-started-with-next-gen-boards-945104903.html], after 14 days, issues in the Done column will be automatically removed from your board and archived.

As a user, I would like to customize the number of days to automatically archive issues in the Done column.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  22nd June 2020}
Hi everyone!

I'm pleased to announce that *we have shipped to everyone the ability to manually clear your DONE issues at any time*: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-manual-board-clearing-for-your-next-gen-Kanban-board/ba-p/1411958#M1379]

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  6th April 2020}
Hi everyone!

I'm Ivan, a Product Manager in Jira Software, and I wanted to update everyone that my team is currently working on the ability to *manually clear issues in the DONE column on an ad-hoc basis.* Please be patient as we just wrapped up our discovery research and design spike, and will be undergoing development work in the next few sprints. The other relevant ticket is here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17582

With regards to finding issues that have been cleared from your DONE column, you will be able to do that through the new ISSUE NAVIGATOR in next-gen as stated here [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-issue-navigator-in-next-gen-projects/ba-p/1339049], which *will ship before manual board clearing*.

Regarding *bringing already-cleared issues back to the board* (which we don't encourage as it might be better to create a new issue instead reflecting the latest thinking about that work), you can simply change the status of the issue.

Let me know if you got any further questions.

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
fields.summary: Customisable Functionality to archive issues in the Done column.

fields.description: Proposed change: On the project settings -> users and roles. When adding a user to roles, there is a modal that pops up.  After selecting users, the Role dropdown should then be a 'forced to set' field instead of defaulting to the 'Administrators' group.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you very much for voting, watching, and/or commenting on this ticket. We appreciate the huge amount of feedback, not just from customers who came directly to this ticket themselves, but also from customers who reached out to our support teams with questions or problems and were then directed to this ticket.

“Board settings” is a very broad problem to solve because, by itself, it doesn’t tell us what exactly customers are trying to configure. Hence, we have read through all the comments here and from tickets raised through our support team. We’ve found that there are several different, specific settings that customers would like to configure, but they have been all broadly amalgamated into the term “board settings”. The settings that have been specifically requested from the comments are:
 * the ability to define working days in a project: JSWCLOUD-17773
 * the ability to find out how many days a card has been in a column: JSWCLOUD-20809
 * the ability to use colours to quickly identify cards: JSWCLOUD-17277
 * the ability to choose which labels appear on cards in the board/backlog: JSWCLOUD-17450
 * the ability to choose which fields appear on cards in the board/backlog: JSWCLOUD-17336
 * the ability to create Components in next-gen projects: JSWCLOUD-17601
 * the ability to have multiple boards in a next-gen project: JSWCLOUD-17371
 * the ability to have a board with issues from multiple projects (including issues from next-gen projects): JSWCLOUD-17444
 * the ability to create templates to be used when creating next-gen projects: JSWCLOUD-17982
 * the ability to create a new status without creating a column (coming really soon!): JSWCLOUD-17434
 * the ability to set limits on the number of issues in a column (you can do this now)

Each of these settings, except the last one, have an existing ticket associated with it. Kindly vote/watch/comment the specific settings that are relevant to you. If you feel the settings you are looking for aren’t listed above, kindly tell us about it. Meanwhile, we will close this ticket.

Again, thank you for your feedback and patience.

Cheers,
 Emily Chan
 Atlassian.
{panel}
Currently, due to the restrictions next-gen projects has, we can't change Working days, card colors, layout, columns issue limits, for example.
 It would be good if we could have the option to change these simple settings on next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Add "Board settings" to next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some reports thrown an error related to Estimation field.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum project
# Set the board's estimate to _Story Points_
# Delete the _Story Points_ from custom fields' page
# Create a new scrum project and the field will be recreated
# Access Sprint/Velocity report on the project created on step 1

h3. Expected Results
The reports loads

h3. Actual Results
Error below is shown: {code}Could not find suitable statistics field with ID 'customfield_XXXXX.{code}
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3. Workaround
# Open the impacted board
# Go to *Estimation* settings
# Select a different *Estimation Statistic*
# Select *Story Points*
fields.summary: Error message pops up for boards that have a removed/invalid custom field set as Estimation Statistic
